paragraph: CHAPTER XII. _A Terrible Misfortune_
tokens: terrible

paragraph: WHEN the ladies left, and the prince and the other gentlemen were alone, the ambassador appeared more gloomy than ever. At last he took the prince into a corner, on pretence of showing him a rare statue. “Does your royal highness not know,” he asked, “that you are in considerable danger?” “Still?” said the prince, thinking of the Firedrake.
tokens: lady leave prince other gentleman alone ambassador appear gloomy last take prince corner pretence show rare statue royal highness know ask considerable danger say prince think

paragraph: The ambassador did not know what he meant, for _he_ had never heard of the fight, but he answered gravely: “Never more than now.” Then he showed the prince two proclamations, which had been posted all about the town. Here is the first:
tokens: ambassador know mean _he_ hear fight answer show prince proclamation post town first

paragraph: TO  ALL  LOYAL  SUBJECTS.
tokens: loyal subuect

paragraph: Whereas,
Our eldest son, Prince Prigio, hath of late been guilty of      several high crimes and misdemeanours.
tokens: old son have guilty several high crime misdemeanour

paragraph: First: By abandoning the post of danger against the      Firedrake, whereby our beloved sons, Prince Alphonso and      Prince Enrico, have perished, and been overdone by that      monster.
tokens: abandon post danger beloved son perish overdo monster

paragraph: Secondly: By attending an unseemly revel in the town of      Gluckstein, where he brawled in the streets.
tokens: attend unseemly revel town brawl street

paragraph: Thirdly: By trying to seduce away the hearts of our loyal      subjects in that city, and to blow up a party against our      crown and our peace.
tokens: try seduce heart loyal subject city blow party crown peace

paragraph: This is to give warning,
tokens: give warning

paragraph: That whoever consorts with, comforts, aids, or abets the      said Prince Prigio, is thereby a partner in his treason; and      That a reward of Five Thousand Purses will be given to      whomsoever brings the said prince, alive, to our Castle of      Falkenstein.
tokens: consort comfort aid abet say partner treason reward purse give bring say prince alive

paragraph: Grognio R.
And here is the second proclamation:
tokens: second proclamation

paragraph: Reward. The firedrake. _Whereas_,
tokens: reward firedrake whereas_

paragraph: Our dominions have lately been devastated by a Firedrake      (the _Salamander Furiosus_ of Buffon);
tokens: dominion devastate

paragraph: _This is to advise all_,
tokens: advise all_

paragraph: That whosoever brings the horns and tail of the said      Firedrake to our Castle of Falkenstein, shall receive Five      Thousand Purses, the position of Crown Prince, with the      usual perquisites, and the hand of the king’s niece, the      Lady Molinda.
tokens: bring horn tail say receive purse position usual perquisite hand king niece

paragraph: Grognio R.
“H’m,” said the prince; “I did not think his majesty wrote so well;”  and he would have _liked_ to say, “Don’t you think we might join the ladies?”
tokens: say prince think majesty write have _liked_ say think join lady

paragraph: “But, sir,” said the ambassador, “the streets are lined with soldiers; and I know not how you have escaped them. _Here_, under my roof, you are safe for the moment; but a prolonged stay--excuse my inhospitality--could not but strain the harmonious relations which prevail between the Government of Pantouflia and that which I have the honour to represent.”
tokens: sir say ambassador street line soldier know escape roof safe moment prolonged stay excuse inhospitality strain harmonious relation prevail have honour represent

paragraph: “We don’t want to fight; and no more, I think, do you,” said the prince, smiling.
tokens: want fight more think say prince smile

paragraph: “Then how does your royal highness mean to treat the proclamations?”
tokens: royal highness mean treat proclamation

paragraph: “Why, by winning these ten thousand purses. I can tell you £1,000,000 is worth having,” said the prince. “I ‘ll deliver up the said prince, alive, at Falkenstein this very night; also the horns and tail of the said Firedrake. But I don’t want to marry my Cousin Molly.”
tokens: win purse tell worth have say prince deliver say prince alive very night horn tail say want marry cousin

paragraph: “May I remind your royal highness that Falkenstein is three hundred miles away? Moreover, my head butler, Benson, disappeared from the house before dinner, and I fear he went to warn Captain Kopzoffski that you are _here!_”
tokens: remind royal highness mile head butler disappear house dinner fear go warn _here

paragraph: “That is nothing,” said the prince; “but, my dear Lord Kelso, may I not have the pleasure of presenting Lady Rosalind with a little gift, a Philippine which I lost to her last night, merely the head and tail of a Firedrake which I stalked this morning?”
tokens: say prince dear have pleasure present little gift lose last night head tail stalked morning

paragraph: The ambassador was so astonished that he ran straight upstairs, forgetting his manners, and crying:
tokens: ambassador astonished run forget manners cry

paragraph: “Linda! Linda! come down at once; here’s a surprise for you!”
tokens: come surprise

paragraph: Lady Rosalind came sweeping down, with a smile on her kind face. _She_ guessed what it was, though the prince had said nothing about it at dinner.
tokens: come sweep smile kind face guess prince say dinner

paragraph: “Lead the way, your royal highness!” cried the ambassador; and the prince offering Lady Rosalind his arm, went out into the hall, where he saw neither his carpet nor the horns and tail of the Firedrake!
tokens: lead way royal highness cry ambassador prince offer arm go hall see carpet horn tail

paragraph: He turned quite pale, and said:
tokens: turn pale say

paragraph: “Will you kindly ask the servants where the little Persian prayer-rug and the parcel which I brought with me have been placed?”
tokens: ask servant little persian prayer rug parcel bring place

paragraph: Lord Kelso rang the bell, and in came all the servants, with William, the under-butler, at their head.
tokens: ring bell come servant under butler head

paragraph: “William,” said his lordship, “where have you put his royal highness’s parcel and his carpet?”
tokens: say lordship put royal highness parcel carpet

paragraph: “Please, your lordship,” said William, “we think Benson have took them away with him.”
tokens: lordship say think take

paragraph: “And where is Benson?”
“We don’t know, your lordship. We think he have been come for!”
tokens: know lordship think come

paragraph: “Come for--by whom?”
tokens: come

paragraph: William stammered, and seemed at a loss for a reply.
tokens: stammer seem loss reply

paragraph: “Quick! answer! what do you know about it?”
tokens: quick answer know

paragraph: William said at last, rather as if he were making a speech:
tokens: say last make speech

paragraph: “Your royaliness, and my lords and ladies, it was like this. His royaliness comed in with a rug over his arm, and summat under it. And he lays it down on that there seat, and Thomas shows him into the droring-room. Then Benson says: ‘Dinner’ll be ready in five minutes; how tired I do feel! ‘Then he takes the libbuty of sitting hisself down on his royaliness’s rug, and he says, asking your pardon, ‘I ‘ve had about enough of service here. I ‘m about tired, and I thinks of bettering myself. I wish I was at the king’s court, and butler.’
tokens: royaliness lord lady royaliness come rug arm summat lay seat show droring room say dinner ready minute tired feel take libbuty sit hisself royaliness rug say ask pardon have enough service tired think better wish king court butler

paragraph: But before the words was out of his mouth, off he flies like a shot through the open door, and his royaliness’s parcel with him. I run to the door, and there he was, flying right hover the town, in a northerly direction. And that’s all I know; for I would not tell a lie, not if it was hever so. And me, and Thomas--as didn’t see it,--and cook, we thinks as how Benson was come for. And cook says as she don’t wonder at it, neither; for a grumblinger, more ill-conditioneder--”
tokens: word mouth fly shot open door royaliness parcel run door fly hover town northerly direction know tell lie see cook think come cook say wonder grumblinger ill conditioneder

paragraph: “Thank you, William,” said Lord Kelso; “that will do; you can go, for the present.”
tokens: thank say do go present
